Description: Neck and shoulder fragment of East Greek pottery open vase, probably krater; slipped on the exterior; thin glaze on inside of neck. Outside, on neck, perhaps hoofed animal to right (its hoof remains at right break) with blob rosette and round incised rosette in the field. Tongues on shoulder; broad glaze band below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 16, no. 49 pl. 12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.561)
